intro: Pronephrium kjellbergii, commonly known as the Kjellberg's bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like structures called bladders, which are used for capturing microscopic organisms. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and ditches. It has slender, branched stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on aquatic plant adaptations and nutrient uptake.
